forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: A chance of rain after 11pm. Mostly cloudy, with a low around 52. Southwest wind 9 to 14 mph. Chance of precipitation is 40%. New rainfall amounts between a tenth and quarter of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Monday
forecast.detailedForecast: A chance of rain before 5pm. Partly sunny. High near 60, with temperatures falling to around 58 in the afternoon. West southwest wind around 15 mph, with gusts as high as 21 mph. Chance of precipitation is 40%. New rainfall amounts between a tenth and quarter of an inch possible.

weather_report:
As the sun retreats and twilight blankets Downtown San Francisco, a tapestry of clouds hangs low, hinting at the prospect of rain gently touching the city later tonight. The air is cool, hovering around fifty-two degrees, a crisp reminder of the coastal winds that weave through the streets with an inviting rustle. A soft southwest breeze, playful yet brisk, brings whispers of moisture, echoing the forecast's 40% chance of rain along with its promise of a delicate drizzle, potentially painting the pavement with a fresh shimmer overnight.

Looking to Monday, expect somewhat of a dance—the sun will strive to pierce through the clouds, bringing a moment of cheer before temperatures gradually wane in the afternoon. The high will flirt with sixty degrees, caressing the cool air with warmth yet again. The morning might embrace a subtle marine layer, hinting at the ever-present fog, which may cling to the tops of the hills and soften the outlines of the skyline. For those venturing out, a light jacket or sweater will suffice, a shield against the lingering chill, especially if you plan to wander through the Mission or sip coffee by the waterfront. As the day unfolds, a casual stroll or a visit to a quiet bookstore might be just the remedy, allowing you to savor the unique ambiance that only San Francisco can offer, all while keeping an eye towards the horizon for those possibly dramatic rain clouds.
